code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:male aged 54 yrs presents via EMS a short time following MVA. he was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the back of the head (22 min LOC). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 20 mph on impact. pt c/o mild vomiting, moderate nausea, severe headache and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 66 in, Weight 115 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:54 year old male returns for f/u approx. one (1) week s/p concussion with LOC 22 min. denies headache, vomiting and nausea. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. o:Height 66 in, Weight 115 lbs, Temperature 98.9 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=96,Visual Memory=95,Processing Speed=44,Reaction Time=0.48, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: - hour hourly checks were without incident
No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination
